alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:01AM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River Above Farmville affecting Amelia, Prince Edward and Cumberland Counties. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville, Mattoax, Matoaca... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River above Farmville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River Rd downstream of the gage near the railroad bridge begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:50 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:50 AM EST Wednesday was 18.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.8 feet on 03/21/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM EST.
